metadata.Title: CVE-2022-48425 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In the Linux kernel through 6.2.7, fs/ntfs3/inode.c has an invalid kfree because it does not validate MFT flags before replaying logs. It was discovered that the NTFS file system implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly validate MFT flags in certain situations. An attacker could use this to construct a malicious NTFS image that, when mounted and operated on, could cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48425` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-34-generic - 6.2.0-34.34
linux-image-6.2.0-34-generic-lpae - 6.2.0-34.34
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-34-generic - 6.2.0-34.34
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-34-generic-64k - 6.2.0-34.34
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1013-aws - 6.2.0-1013.13
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-34.34').
